005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.ITimeWithTimeZoneItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
016
017import java.time.DateTimeException;
018import java.time.OffsetTime;
019import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
020import java.util.List;
021
022import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
023
024/**
025 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
026 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#date-time-with-timezone">date-time-with-timezone</a>
027 * data type.
028 */
029public class TimeWithTZAdapter
030    extends AbstractDataTypeAdapter<OffsetTime, ITimeWithTimeZoneItem> {
031  @NonNull
032  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
033      List.of(
034          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "time-with-timezone")));
035
036  TimeWithTZAdapter() {
037    super(OffsetTime.class, ITimeWithTimeZoneItem.class, ITimeWithTimeZoneItem::cast);
038  }
039
040  @Override
041  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
042    return NAMES;
043  }
044
045  @Override
046  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
047    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
048  }
049
050  @SuppressWarnings("null")
051  @Override
052  public OffsetTime parse(String value) {
053    try {
054      return OffsetTime.from(DateFormats.TIME_WITH_TZ.parse(value));
055    } catch (DateTimeParseException ex) {
056      throw new IllegalArgumentException(ex.getLocalizedMessage(), ex);
057    }
058  }
059
060  @SuppressWarnings("null")
061  @Override
062  public String asString(Object value) {
063    try {
064      return DateFormats.TIME_WITH_TZ.format(toValue(value));
065    } catch (DateTimeException ex) {
066      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
067          String.format("The provided value '%s' cannot be formatted as a time value. %s",
068              value.toString(),
069              ex.getMessage()),
070          ex);
071    }
072  }
073
074  @SuppressWarnings("null")
075  @Override
076  public OffsetTime copy(Object obj) {
077    return OffsetTime.from((OffsetTime) obj);
078  }
079
080  @Override
081  public ITimeWithTimeZoneItem newItem(Object value) {
082    OffsetTime item = toValue(value);
083    return ITimeWithTimeZoneItem.valueOf(item);
084  }
085}
